it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller.weapons.targets

Class SingleSquareTarget

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller.weapons.targets.AbstractTarget
      • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller.weapons.targets.SingleSquareTarget
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlayerTarget, SquareTarget

    public abstract class SingleSquareTarget
extends AbstractTarget
    Represents a target of TargetingEffect which stays on a single square.

    Provides filters and commands to restrict selection of the square where the actual target resides.

    These are:
    • visibility: the visibility constraint of the targeted square from the shooter
    • visibleFromPlayer: the target square must be visible from the player, saved in the weapon, with specified id
    • minDist and maxDist: minimum and maximum distance (inclusive) of the target square from the shooter
    • excludePlayers:: players (represented by target ids) that will be excluded from the targeting scope
    • excludePlayers: squares (represented by their target ids) that will be excluded from the targeting scope
    • moveShooterHere: will move the shooter in the target square after shooting
    • squareRef: saves the targeted square in the weapon, with the given id
    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleSquareTarget

        public SingleSquareTarget(String id,
                          AbstractWeapon weapon,
                          Match match,
                          ControllerFactory factory)
        Creates a new single square target associated to the given weapon. While the id is set on initialization, the other properties receive their default values, which can be changed later by using setters.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique identifier of this target in its effect, not null
        weapon - The weapon controller associated to this target, not null
        match - The match which has to be controlled, not null
        factory - The factory to create needed controllers, not null

      • determineSelectableSquares

        protected Set<Square> determineSelectableSquares(Square start)
        Determines and returns the squares which are selectable for targeting according to the following constraints:
        • Direction of the weapon (if already set)
        • Visibility
        • Minimum and maximum distance
        • Squares to be excluded via excludeSquares
        • Visibility from specified player target (visibleFromPlayer)
        Parameters:
        start - The square from which to calculate distances, not null
        Returns:
        The selectable squares according to given criteria

      • execute

        public abstract boolean execute(PersistentView view)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Executes this target given the user of the weapon
        Specified by:
        execute in class AbstractTarget
        Parameters:
        view - The view of the player using the weapon
        Returns:
        true if the player chose his target and was able to perform damage/marks false if the player chose not to use the target
        Throws:
        CancellationException - if a request to the user gets cancelled
        InterruptedException - if the thread gets interrupted
